Class QuadTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • QuadTree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable

    public class QuadTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable
    A class that stores Entities in recursive quadrant branches. This is to make retrieval and collision checking more efficient. A QuadTree object contains one root QuadBranch and one list of outlier Entities that are not within the bounds of the root QuadBranch.
    Author:
    Jiayin Huang, Sally Hui, Tony Cui
    See Also:
    QuadBranch, Serialized Form

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • path

        public QuadTreePath path
        The path to this QuadTree is represented with {-2}. Specifically, that path refers to the list of outlier Entities that are stored at this level.

      • root

        private QuadBranch root
        The root QuadBranch for this QuadTree.

      • outliers

        private java.util.List<Entity> outliers
        The list of all outlier Entities that do not belong to the root QuadBranch.

      • size

        private int size
        The number of Entities in this QuadTree.

      • QuadTree

        public QuadTree()
        Creates an empty QuadTree implementation with no defined QuadBranches.

      • QuadTree

        public QuadTree(double minX,
        double minY,
        double maxX,
        double maxY)
        Creates a new QuadTree with a root QuadBranch of the specified bounds.
        Parameters:
        minX - the smallest x-coordinate of the QuadTree.
        minY - the smallest y-coordinate of the QuadTree.
        maxX - the largest x-coordinate of the QuadTree.
        maxY - the largest y-coordinate of the QuadTree.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Entity e)
        Adds the specified Entity to this QuadTree. If the bounding rectangle of the Entity's shape is entirely contained by the root QuadBranch, the task of adding the Entity is passed down to that QuadBranch. Otherwise, the Entity is added to the outliers list here in this QuadTree instance.
        Parameters:
        e - the Entity to be added

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Entity e)
        Attempts to remove the specified Entity from the QuadTree. Returns false if the specified Entity could not be found.
        Parameters:
        e - the Entity to be removed
        Returns:
        true if this QuadTree was changed as a result of this removal; false otherwise

      • reset

        public void reset(double minX,
         double minY,
         double maxX,
         double maxY)
        Clears this QuadTree and sets a new QuadBranch with the specified bounds.
        Parameters:
        minX - the smallest x-coordinate of the QuadTree.
        minY - the smallest y-coordinate of the QuadTree.
        maxX - the largest x-coordinate of the QuadTree.
        maxY - the largest y-coordinate of the QuadTree.

      • get

        public java.util.ArrayList<Entity> get()
        Returns an array containing all of the Entities in this QuadTree.
        Returns:
        an array containing all of the Entities in this QuadTree

      • get

        public java.util.ArrayList<Entity> get(double x,
                              double y)
        Returns an array containing all of the Entities in the deepest QuadBranch that contains the specified point. This includes all of the Entities are entirely within that QuadBranch, as well as all of the noncommittal Entities that are only partially in that QuadBranch.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the point
        y - the y-coordinate of the point
        Returns:
        an array containing all of the Entities in the QuadBranch as the specified point

      • get

        public java.util.ArrayList<Entity> get(Entity e)
        Returns an array containing all of the Entities in the same QuadBranch as the specified Entity, including itself. If the Entity is a noncommittal, i.e. it is in more than one QuadBranch, this method retrieves all of the Entities and noncommittal Entities from all of the QuadBranches that contain a noncommittal copy of the specified Entity. This method ensures that there are no duplicate Entities during collection by using a HashSet instead of an ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        e - the specified Entity
        Returns:
        an array containing all of the Entities in same QuadBranch or QuadBranches as the bounding rectangle of the shape of the specified Entity

      • get

        public java.util.ArrayList<Entity> get(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D bounds)
        Returns an array containing all of the Entities in the deepest QuadBranch that contains the specified Rectangle. This includes all of the Entities are entirely within that QuadBranch, as well as all of the noncommittal Entities that are only partially in that QuadBranch. If the specified rectangle occupies more than one QuadBranch, this method retrieves all of the Entities and noncommittal Entities from all of the QuadBranches that intersect the specified Rectangle.
        Parameters:
        bounds - the specified Rectangle
        Returns:
        an array containing all of the Entities that occupy the same QuadBranch or QuadBranches the specified Rectangle

      • getBounds

        public java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getBounds()
        Returns a Rectangle2D.Double representing the boundaries of this QuadTree.
        Returns:
        the Rectangle2D.Double object representing this QuadTree's bounds

      • getBranch

        protected QuadBranch getBranch(QuadTreePath path)
        Retrieves the QuadBranch specified by the given QuadTreePath. Returns the deepest possible QuadBranch if the chain of branches ends before the QuadTreePath does.

        As specified by the constant field variables in the QuadTreePath class:
        {-2} -> the outliers list in the master QuadTree
        {-1} -> the root QuadBranch
        {...,0} -> north-east quadrant
        {...,1} -> north-west quadrant
        {...,2} -> south-west quadrant
        {...,3} -> south-east quadrant

        Note that cardinal directions are relative to the Cartesian plane, where y-values increase from bottom to top.

        Parameters:
        path - the QuadTree path to the desired QuadBranch
        Returns:
        the QuadBranch, or null if either the path was null or if the path specifies the master QuadTree

      • getInliers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Entity> getInliers()
        Returns an array containing all of the Entities that are contained within the root QuadBranch.
        Returns:
        all containing the Entities within the root QuadBranch

      • getOutliers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Entity> getOutliers()
        Returns an array containing all of the Entities that are not contained within the root QuadBranch.
        Returns:
        all containing the outlier Entities

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the number of Entities in this QuadTree.
        Returns:
        the number of Entities in this QuadTree

      • revalidate

        public void revalidate(Entity e)
        Rechecks the specified Entity's current placement in the QuadTree, and repositions it if necessary. If the Entity is in more than one QuadBranch, each of the noncommittal copies of the Entity in all of the child QuadBranches are checked accordingly.
        Parameters:
        e - the Entity to revalidate

      • searchDownwards

        public QuadTreePath searchDownwards(Entity e)
        Attempts to find the specified Entity in this QuadTree structure. Returns the QuadTreePath of the Entity if found, or null if not found.
        Parameters:
        e - the Entity to be search for
        Returns:
        the QuadTreePath of the Entity if found; null otherwise

      • searchUpwards

        public QuadTreePath searchUpwards(Entity e)
        Attempts to find the specified Entity in this QuadTree structure. Starts the search at the QuadBranch specified by the Entity's QuadTreePath variable. First searches down from that location. If not found, goes up a level, and searches down in all of the child QuadBranches of that QuadBranch. Stops at the root QuadBranch. Does not search outliers.
        Parameters:
        e - the Entity to be search for
        Returns:
        the QuadTreePath of the Entity if found; null otherwise
